intro: Bulbophyllum savaiense subsp. savaiense, commonly known as the Savaiene Pterostigma, is a rare orchid species native to the island of Savaii in Samoa. It is characterized by its distinctive, elongated pseudobulbs and clusters of small, fragrant flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are usually dark green and革质, providing a waxy texture that helps retain moisture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
